Author: breadphobic
Text: I can relate, sometimes I go through normal periods for no apparent reason. I find its really helpful to be mindful of how much better I feel when I’m not engaging in ED behaviours, so when the urge to fall back into old habits arises I try to focus on how good “recovery” felt

Author: zarifeh
Text: Hello,  I want to start off with sharing that you are not alone in this cycle you feel that you are in, and I’m glad you are aware that this unhealthy eating disorder can reoccur again. For myself, when I begin to notice my unhealthy habits of not eating, I isolate myself from family, friends, hobbies that I enjoy, and I’m “in my head” too much. To help myself, i inform someone who cares about me, and try my best to surround myself with family/friends who see my self worth that I struggle with seeing.    Ask yourself if you’re developing symptoms of bulimia. What are those symptoms, and how can you help yourself from relapsing? Remember you’re doing an amazing job taking care of yourself right now, how can you maintain that?
